news_header: Evo Morales claims he survived an assassination attempt after gunmen shot at his car, wounding his driver. He blames the attack on current president Luis Arce and alleges it was planned to kill him.
news_text: Former Bolivian President Evo Morales reported surviving an assassination attempt when unidentified assailants fired at his vehicle, leaving 14 bullet holes. Speaking on his radio show, he stated that a bullet narrowly missed his head and accused current President Luis Arce of orchestrating the attack. While Morales was unharmed, his driver sustained injuries. The incident follows ongoing tensions between Morales and Arce as they compete for the MAS party's nomination for the upcoming presidential elections. Morales, who served as president from 2006 to 2019, is also facing serious legal allegations, which he claims are politically motivated.
